The monkeys

are too big and bulky

to climb up the tree,

and their jaws are too weak

to eat the fruit

on the ground

with the hard shell.

Therefore

a new variety evolves.

The monkeys of the new

variety are smaller and nimble; they can eat the fruit

at the top of the trees.

A second variety also emerges, born with strong jaws that can bite and chew

the hard-shelled fruit.

159
